intro: Siparuna cuzcoana, commonly known as the Cuzco beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy surface. Siparuna cuzcoana is often found growing in moist, shaded areas of the understorey in tropical forests.
